Column: 145

[Mr Speaker in the Chair]

ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS

URBAN RENEWAL AND
PLANNING DEPARTMENTS
(Setting up of statutory body to take
over functions)


    1. Mr Low Yong Nguan asked the Minister for Law and National Development if he will consider setting up a statutory body to take over the functions presently performed by both the Urban Renewal Department of the Housing and Development Board and the Planning Department of his Ministry.

    The Minister for Law and National Development (Mr E. W. Barker): Mr Speaker, Sir, as the Member is aware,

Column: 146

the Urban Renewal Department is a department of the Housing and Development Board which is a statutory body. On the other hand, the Planning Department is a department of the Government. The Member's proposal for merger has many implications which will have to be carefully examined before a decision can be made. However, the feasibility of the proposal will be examined by my Ministry.

Column: 146

PALEMBANG HOUSING ESTATE
(Market)


    2. Mr Low Yong Nguan asked the Minister for Law and National Development if he will ascertain from the Housing and Development Board whether the Board plans to build a market

Column: 147

in the vicinity of the present Palembang Housing Estate.

    Mr Barker: Mr Speaker, Sir, the Urban Renewal Department has plans to build a market on a vacant site between North Bridge Road and Rochore Canal in the vicinity of Palembang Housing Estate. Piling for the project is expected to begin towards the end of this year, and it is expected that the market will be completed by the end of next year. The market will provide about 450 stalls to resettle hawkers in Precinct North 1 and the stallholders in Clyde Terrace Market.

    Hon. Members indicated assent.
